tuv.seg: • Work and social insurance
• Obair agus árachas sóisialach
• Social insurance payments and benefits
• Íocaíochtaí agus sochair árachais shóisialaigh

Most employers and employees (over 16 years of age and under 66) pay social insurance (PRSI) contributions into the national Social Insurance Fund. In general, the payment of social insurance is compulsory
Íocann an chuid is mó de na fostaitheoirí agus fostaithe (os cionn 16 bliana d’aois agus faoi 66) ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh isteach i gCiste Árachais Shóisialta náisiúnta na hÉireann
Some people who have unearned income are also liable for PRSI
Go ginearálta, tá íocaíocht an árachais shóisialaigh éigeantach
The Social Insurance Fund is made up of a current account and an investment account managed by the Minister for Social Protection and the Minister for Finance, respectively
Tá Ciste Árachais Shóisialaigh na hÉireann déanta suas de chuntas reatha agus de chuntas infheistíochta atá á bhainistiú ag an Aire Coimirce Sóisialaí agus ag an Aire Airgeadais, faoi seach
The current account consists of monies collected from people in employment
Is éard atá sa chuntas reatha ná airgead a bailíodh ó dhaoine atá i bhfostaíocht
This money is then used to fund social insurance payments
Baintear úsáid as an airgead ansin le híocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh a mhaoiniú
The investment account is a savings account that is managed by the Minister for Finance
Is cuntas taisce an cuntas infheistíochta atá á bhainistiú ag an Aire Airgeadais
The Comptroller and Auditor General is responsible for ensuring that the accounts are kept in order and reports are made to the Houses of the Oireachtas
Tá an Ard-Reachtaire Cuntas agus Ciste freagrach as a chinntiú go gcoinnítear na cuntais in ord agus go ndéantar tuairiscí chuig Tithe an Oireachtais
Social insurance contributions are divided into different categories, known as classes or rates of contribution
Chomh maith le híoc isteach sa Chiste Árachais Shóisialaigh, beifear ag dúil go n-íocfaidh tú rud ar a dtugtar an Ranníocaíocht Sláinte, a ghearrtar ar gach ioncam
The class and rate of contribution you pay is determined by the nature of your work
Ní íoctar an Ranníocaíocht Sláinte isteach sa Chiste Árachais Shóisialaigh

For example, a person employed in a supermarket earning less than €38 per week will be insured under Class J. If that person earned over €38, they would probably be insured under Class A. Most employees pay Class A PRSI
Bailítear an t-airgead seo ó do thuarastal agus íoctar leis an Roinn Sláinte é le seirbhísí sláinte in Éirinn a mhaoiniú
Work and social insurance
Obair agus árachas sóisialach
If you are in employment, the amount of social insurance you pay depends on your earnings and the type of work you do
Má tá tú i bhfostaíocht, braitheann méid an árachais shóisialaigh a íocann tú ar do thuilleamh agus ar an gcineál oibre a dhéanann tú
Your social insurance contributions in Ireland are referred to as PRSI (Pay Related Social Insurance)
Tugtar ÁSPC (Árachas Sóisialach Pá-Choibhneasa) ar do ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh in Éirinn
Sometimes, you will hear people describe their PRSI contributions as stamps
In amanna, cloisfidh tú daoine ag baint úsáide as an bhfocal stampaí agus iad ag trácht ar a rannaíocaíochtaí ÁSPC
This term dated from before 1979 when employers would literally stamp a card each week of employment
Tagann an téarmaí seo ó roimh 1979 nuair a stampáladh fostaitheoirí cárta go fisiceach gach seachtain den fhostaíocht
That card was then brought to a social welfare local office when claiming social welfare payments
Tugadh an cárta sin chuig oifig leasa shóisialaigh áitiúil d’fhonn íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh a éileamh
If you are an employee, your PRSI contributions are deducted by your employer and collected by Revenue under the PAYE (Pay As You Earn) system
Más fostaí thú, asbhaineann d’fhostaitheoir do ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta agus bailíonn na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim iad
In fact, the law makes your employer responsible for PRSI, though you may have to pay an 'employee's share'
De réir an dlí, tá d’fhostaitheoir freagrach as ÁSPC, cé go mb’fhéidir go mbeadh ort ‘sciar fostaí’ a íoc
Find out more about 'Paying social insurance'
Léigh níos mó faoi dhualgas d’fhostaitheora árachas sóisialach a íoc anseo
If you are self-employed, you pay Class S social insurance contributions directly to the Revenue Commissioners
Má tá tú féinfhostaithe, íocann tú ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh Aicme S go díreach leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
The Revenue Commissioners then pay the money into the Social Insurance Fund
Ansin íocann na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim an t-airgead isteach sa Chiste Árachais Shóisialaigh
Revenue send a record of the contributions you have paid to the Department of Social Protection
Cuireann na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim taifead de na ranníocaíochtaí atá íoctha agat chuig an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí
You are not liable for PRSI contributions after the age of 66 - this is the case whether or not you are employed or self-employed
Níl dliteanas ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC ort tar éis aois 66 – tá sé seo amhlaidh is cuma an fostaithe nó féin-fhostaithe atá tú
If you do not have enough contributions at age 66, you cannot add to them after that
Muna bhfuil dóthain íocaíochtaí agat ag aois 66, ní féidir leat cur leo ina dhiaidh sin
From 2014 unearned income became fully liable for PRSI. Unearned income from rents, investments, dividends and interest on deposits and savings is liable to PRSI at 4% from 1 January 2014
Do dhaoine i bhfostaíocht in Éirinn, roinntear ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh i gcatagóirí difriúla, ar a dtugtar aicmí nó rátaí ranníocaíochta
People aged under 16 and over 66 are exempt from PRSI and are not liable for the new charge
Cinntear an cineál aicme agus ráta ranníocaíochta a íocann tú de réir nádúr do chuid oibre
Anyone with unearned income of over €5,000 (was €3,174) is considered to be a 'chargeable person' and is liable to pay the PRSI charge at 4% on all their unearned income
Mar shampla, beidh duine atá fostaithe in ollmhargadh a thuilleann níos lú ná €38 sa tseachtain árachaithe faoi Aicme J
They pay the charge under Revenue's self-assessment system (Pay and File)
Má thuilleann siad níos mó ná €38 sa tseachtain beidh siad árachaithe faoi Aicme A
The new PRSI charge is paid at Class K and does not entitle the person to any social insurance benefits
I bhfírinne, íocann an chuid is mó de na fostaithe in Éirinn ÁSPC Aicme A
(Generally such income is taxed by reducing a person’s tax credits to account for tax payable
Is iad na haicmí eile árachais ná aicmí C, D, B, E, H, J, S, K, M, agus P
However if you have paid Deposit Interest Retention Tax (DIRT) on your non-PAYE income you are not required to pay further income tax on this income.)

Má tá tú árachaithe faoi cheann de na haicmí seo, tá tú ag íoc árachais ag ráta níos ísle ná ranníocóirí aicme A, agus ciallaíonn sé seo nach bhfuil tú i dteideal an réimse iomlán íocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh
The Department of Social Protection has published Information on the Extension of PRSI liability to unearned income
Tá sé seo de bharr go bhfuil tú ag íoc níos lú árachais shóisialaigh ná ranníocóir aicme A agus P
You can also read FAQs on the broadening of the income tax base for PRSI
Beidh méid an ÁSPC a íocann tú ag brath ar do thuillimh agus an aicme a bhfuil tú árachaithe faoi
Employing family members and PRSI
Ag coinneáil d’árachas sóisialach
If the business does not operate on a sole trader basis - for example if it is a limited company or a partnership - it is not family employment
Tá sé tábhachtach go gcoinníonn tú do thaifead árachais shóisialaigh, chomh fada agus is féidir
The following categories of family employment are insurable under the social insurance system in exactly the same way as employments that have no family connection:
Má fhágann tú saol na hoibre, tá sé tábhachtach go gcoinníonn tú do thaifead árachais shóisialaigh gníomhach

• If you are employed as an apprentice by a prescribed relative (even if the apprenticeship employment relates to a private dwelling house or a farm in or on which both you and the employer resides) there must be a registered contract of apprenticeship involved (PRSI Class A or Class J applies)

Le do thaifead árachais shóisialaigh a chosaint agus a choinneáil gníomhach, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí lena sheiceáil an féidir leat Ranníocaíochtaí Creidiúnaithe a fháil
• If you assist your spouse or civil partner in the running of the family business but are not an employee (PRSI Class S applies)
B’fhéidir go mbeifeá in ann, in imthosca áirithe, Ranníocaíochtaí Deonacha a dhéanamh
A prescribed relative is a parent, grandparent, stepparent, son, daughter, grandson, granddaughter, stepson, stepdaughter, brother, sister, half-brother, or half-sister

Chomh maith leis sin, is féidir leat do ranníocaíochtaí Éireannacha agus do rannaíocaíochtaí a d’íoc tú i stáit eile agus tú ag obair thar lear a chur le chéile le bheith incháilithe ar íocaíocht árachais shóisialaigh

• •A spouse or civil partner employed by their self-employed spouse or civil partner • If you are employed as an employee by a prescribed relative and the family employment relates to a private dwelling house or a farm in or on which both you and the employer reside
Más oibrí páirtaimseartha thú nó má tá tú i socrú roinnte poist ba cheart duit smaoineamh faoin dóigh ar féidir le do phatrún oibre dul i bhfeidhm ar do thaifead árachais shóisialaigh

• If you assist or participate in the running of the family business but not as an employee. (For example, a son/daughter who is attending full-time education who participates in the business after school hours or but is not an employee.)

Tá sé seo thar a bheith ábhartha má tá tú páirtaimseartha nó má tá tú ag roinnt oibre le seachtain shaor mar chuid de do phatrún oibre cionn is gur féidir leat gan íocaíocht ÁSPC a dhéanamh don tseachtain nach bhfuil tú ag obair

The €5,000 income threshold applies to these spouses or civil partners in the same way as other self-employed people, so if a spouse or civil partner earns less than this threshold they are not liable to pay PRSI
Léigh anseo le níos mó faisnéise a fháil faoi oibrithe páirtaimseartha agus comhroinnte oibre agus ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh

If two or more family members (including spouses or civil partners) operate a business as a partnership and share the profits each business partner is insurable as a self-employed contributor (provided they earn over the €5,000 threshold). Read more about family employment
Is í rannóg na dTaifead ÁSPC sa Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí a choinníonn agus a dhéanann bainistíocht ar gach taifead de do ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh
Points to note: PRSI Class M is used to record situations in which there is no liability to social insurance
Tá an Roinn freagrach as na h-íocaíochtaí déanta do do ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh
Subject to certain conditions, if you cease to be covered by compulsory PRSI you may opt to become insured on a voluntary basis and pay voluntary contributions
Is féidir leat teagmháil a dhéanamh chomh maith le Rannóg na dTaifead sa Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí chun do thaifead ÁSPC a sheiceáil
Your entitlement to these benefits depends on a number of conditions as well as the social insurance contribution requirement
D’fhonn do thaifead árachais shóisialaigh a sheiceáil, beidh do Uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí (PPSN) de dhíth ort
The social insurance qualifying criteria vary, depending on what payment you are applying for. In general, when you apply for a social insurance payment the following will be examined:
Is uimhir shainiúil aitheantais í seo atá de dhíth ort le linn duit a bheith ag déileáil le gníomhaireachtaí stáit
The social insurance payments available include:
Íocaíochtaí agus sochair árachais shóisialaigh
If you leave the workforce, it is important that you keep your social insurance record active
Tá réimse leathan sochar ann atá ar fáil do dhaoine a bhfuil árachas sóisialach íoctha acu
To protect your social insurance record and keep it active, you should contact the Department of Social Protection to check if you can get credited contributions
Tá teidlíocht do na sochair seo ag brath ar roinnt coinníollacha seachas an riachtanas maidir le ranníocaíocht árachais shóisialaigh
It may be possible in certain circumstances for you to make voluntary contributions
Bíonn na critéir cháilithe difriúil, ag brath ar an íocaíocht a bhfuil tú ag cur iarratais isteach ina leith
You can also add Irish contributions and contributions paid in certain other states while working abroad together qualify for a social insurance payment
Go ginearálta, déanfar scrúdú ar na rudaí seo a leanas:
If you are a part-time worker or in a job-sharing work arrangement you should be aware of how your pattern of work can affect your social insurance record
• Cén aicme/aicmí árachais shóisialaigh a d’íoc tú
This is particularly relevant if you are part-time or job-sharing with a week off as part of your work pattern because you may miss out paying a PRSI contribution for the week you are not working
• An aois nuair a thosaigh tú a dhéanamh ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh (tá sé seo i bhfeidhm i gcás na bPinsean Stáit)
Find out more about part-time and job-share workers and social insurance contributions
• Cá mhéad ranníocaíochtaí íoctha agus/nó creidiúnaithe atá déanta agat ó chuaigh tú isteach i bhfostaíocht inárachaithe
All records of your insurance contributions are kept and managed by the PRSI Records section in the Department of Social Protection
• Líon na ranníocaíochtaí a íocadh agus/nó a creidiúnaíodh sa bhliain chánach ábhartha roimh an bhliain sochair ina ndéanann tú an t-éileamh
The Department is responsible for the payments made as a result of your social insurance contributions
Is í an bhliain chánach ábhartha ná an dara bliain dheireanach iomlán cánach sula ndéanann tú éileamh
This number is a unique identification number which you need when dealing with state agencies
• Meánmhéid bhliantúil de líon na ranníocaíochtaí i gcás cuid de na pinsin
